ISSUE.TITLE: Limit consumer responses by # of bytes rather than # of messages
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: `consumer.request.max.messages` should be `consumer.request.max.bytes`. This matches the underlying interface better and can provide better performance than using a # of messages since it can guarantee large responses as long as there is data available.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #20 from confluentinc/common-utils-abstract-performance-test Switch to AbstractPerformanceTest from common-utils.

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Limit the size of consumer read responses by number bytes instead of number of messages. Fixes #15.
